alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 8:24AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY...WEST CENTRAL GOSHEN...WESTERN LARAMIE AND SOUTHERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 824 AM MST...An area of heavy snow was affecting portions of southeastern Albany...western Goshen...western Laramie and southern Platte Counties. Periods of heavy snowfall will persist through 930 AM MST. HAZARD...Strong winds in excess of 45 mph and visibilities less than one half mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. This area of heavy snow WILL BE NEAR... Bordeaux, Slater and Hutton Lake around 850 AM MST. Tie Siding, Pumpkin Vine and The Buttes around 900 AM MST. Vedauwoo around 905 AM MST. Vedauwoo Campground around 910 AM MST. Buford, Granite Springs Reservoir and Granite Springs Campground around 915 AM MST. Crystal Lake Campground and Crystal Lake Reservoir around 920 AM MST. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Roads may suddenly become icy. Take extra precautions by slowing down and increasing the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you.
